<strong>Public :</strong> The API is acc:
Public : The API is accessible to everyone and can be advertised in multiple stores - a central store and/or non-WSO2 stores.
Restricted by roles : The API is visible only to specific user roles in the tenant store that you specify.
<strong>Same as API visibility: </strong:
Same as API visibility: Visible to the same user roles who can see the API.
Visible to my Domain : Visible to all registered users in the API's tenant domain.
Private: Visible only to the API creator's role.
A REST API endpoint based on a URI templ: A REST API endpoint based on a URI template
A list of error codes. If these error co: A list of error codes. If these error codes are received from the endpoint, the endpoint will be suspended.
A list of error codes. If these error codes are received from the endpoint, the request will be subjected to a timeout.
API Definition for Swagger will not be o: API Definition for Swagger will not be overridden with the changes you do to the API.

AbnormalRefreshAlert_Desc: This alert type gets triggered if there is a change in the pattern of renewing access tokens of an application by a user. These alerts could be treated as an indication of a stolen access token.
AbnormalTierUsage_Desc: This alert gets triggered if there is a drastic reduction in API usage for a given API for a given user. These types of alerts should be treated as an indication of a failure of the application using the altered API.
Address endpoint does not support URI te: Address endpoint does not support URI templates.

Defines groups of endpoints for replicat: Defines groups of endpoints for replicated services.The incoming requests are directed to these endpoints in a round robin manner. These endpoints automatically handle the fail-over cases as well

Enable this feature to see a graph (in t: Enable this feature to see a graph (in the Statistics menu ) of the number of requests that leave the API Gateway to destination endpoints (e.g., Load-balanced endpoints).
Enabling an API-level policy will apply: Enabling an API-level policy will apply the selected policy across all resources of the API. The resource-level tier selection will be disabled and will not be taken into consideration within a handler if the API-level policy is available
Enabling the resource level throttling t: Enabling the resource-level throttling tier will apply the configured limits per resource

Failed to delete certificate due to an I: Failed to delete certificate due to an Internal Server Error.

FrequentTierHittingAlert_Desc: This alert type gets triggered if at least one of the two cases below satisfied; if a particular application gets throttled out for hitting the subscribed tier limit of that application more than 10 times (by default) within a day (by default) or if a particular user of an application gets throttled out for hitting the subscribed tier limit of a particular API more than 10 times (by default) within a day (by default)
Specify the labels of the micro gateways: Specify the labels of the Microgateways here. This API will be deployed on the specified Microgateways.
Gateways Unchecked: Since a Gateway environment is not selected, changes will not be done to the Gateways. Do you want to proceed?
HTTP is less secure than HTTPS and makes: HTTP is less secure than HTTPS and makes your API vulnerable to security threats.
If gateway URLs need to be changed, de-s: If Gateway URLs need to be changed de-select 'Use Defaults' and enter the URLs. If you do not enter a URL, the default URLs will be added from the configurations.
Limits the total number of calls the API: Limits the total number of calls the API Manager is allowed to make to the backend.
Link to documentation is managed by an e: Link to documentation is managed by an external configuration management system
Making an API version the default will a: Making an API version the default will allow the subscribers to invoke it without the version attribute in the URI.
Marks one API version in a group as the: Marks one API version in a group as the default so that it can be invoked without specifying the version number in the URL. For example, if you mark http://host:port/youtube/2.0 as the default API, requests made to http://host:port/youtube/ are automatically routed to version 2.0. If you mark an unpublished API as the default, the previous default published API will still be used as the default until the new default API is published

Marks one API version in a group as the default so that it can be invoked without specifying the version number in the URL. For example, if you mark http://host:port/youtube/2.0 as the default API, requests made to http://host:port/youtube/ are automatically routed to version 2.0. If you mark an unpublished API as the default, the previous default published API will still be used as the default until the new default API is published

Marks one API version in a group as the default so that it can be invoked without specifying the version number in the URL. For example, if you mark http://host:port/youtube/2.0 as the default API, requests made to http://host:port/youtube/ get automatically routed to version 2.0. If you mark an unpublished API as the default while the previously default API was a published one, the users who invoke the default API will still be routed to the previous default version rather than the new one. This is because the new version is not published yet.

Note: The total time represents the comp: Note: The total time represents the complete time taken to process the request, including the time spent in between the other recorded layers. It is not the aggregate sum of the rest of the recorded matrices.

RequestPatternChanged_Desc: This alert type gets triggered if there is a change in the resource access pattern of a user of a particular application. These alerts could be treated as an indication of a suspicious activity made by a user over your application.
Restricted by roles, only visible to: Restricted by roles, only visible to
Save the changes to the document and sta: Save the changes to the document and stay in this tab
Save the document and close this tab: Save the document and close this tab
Select the OPTIONS method to send OPTION: Select the OPTIONS method to send OPTIONS calls to the backend. If the OPTIONS method is not selected, OPTIONS calls will be returned from the Gateway with allowed methods.
Select the authentication scheme you req: Select the authentication scheme you require.
Since there aren't resources for Websock: Since resources do not exist for Websocket APIs, advanced throttling policies apply to the API-level
Some of the gateway environments are not: Changes will not be applied to the Gateways that you have not selected.
The Endpoint for the certificate does no: The endpoint for the certificate does not match the configured endpoint
The Production Endpoint is the actual ba: The Production endpoint is the actual backend endpoint URL of the API.
The Sandbox Endpoint is a mock endpoint: The Sandbox endpoint is a mock endpoint that resembles the functionality of the actual backend API.
The action to be made at a timeout situa: The action to be made at a timeout situation. You can select from: 1) Never Timeout 2) Discard Message 3) Execute Fault Sequence
The algorithm on which the load balancin: The algorithm on which the load balancing is based.
The content the WSDL is saved as a resou: The content the WSDL is saved as a resource in the /system/governance/apimgt/applicationdata/wsdls registry location. API artifacts have a dependency to this resource. Its original service address is reset to the API Gateway's address to prevent direct calls to the service endpoint. The registry permalink of the WSDL resource is shown in the API Store and users can download and create a service out of it.
The delay between retries, in millisecon: The delay between retries, in milliseconds.
The direct URL of the service: The direct URL of the service
The duration for which the endpoint is s: The duration for which the endpoint is suspended for the first time after the receiving the suspended error codes.
The duration to suspend can vary from th: The duration to suspend can vary from the first time suspension to the subsequent time. The factor value decides the suspense duration variance between subsequent suspensions.
The duration, in milliseconds, before a: The duration, in milliseconds, before a request is considered as a timeout.
The dynamic endpoint will send the messa: The dynamic endpoint will send the message to the address specified in the 'To' header.
The endpoints that the service tries to: The endpoints that the service tries to connect to in case of a failure. This happens in a round robin manner.
The endpoints where the incoming request: The endpoints where the incoming requests are directed to in a round robin manner. They automatically handle fail-over as well.
The following APIs have been created. AP: The following APIs have been created. APIs that are marked as PUBLISHED can be subscribed to through the API Store.
The image file exceeds the maximum limit: The image file exceeds the maximum limit of 1MB.
The maximum duration that the endpoint i: The maximum duration for which the endpoint is suspended after receiving the suspended error codes .
The new algorithm on which the load bala: The new algorithm on which the load balancing is based.
The number of milliseconds before the se: The number of milliseconds before the session times out.
The number of retries in case of a timeo: The number of retries in case of a timeout, caused by the above listed error codes.
The tiers selected here determine which: The tiers selected here determine which tiers are available to a subscriber when subscribing to this API. Each tier indicates the number of requests the subscriber is granted within a unit time.
There is no documentation created for th: There is no documentation created for this API. You can add new documentation to this API by clicking the "Add New Document" button.
This API is not PUBLISHED. Please remove: This API is not PUBLISHED. Please remove from external stores.
This option determines whether to cache: This option determines whether to cache the response messages of the API. Caching improves performance because the backend server does not have to process the same data multiple times. To offset the risk of stale data in the cache, set an appropriate timeout period when prompted.
This option specifies the tenants who ca: This option specifies the tenants who can subscribe to an API in a multi-tenanted setup. Available to current Tenant Only: only users in the current organization/tenant domain can subscribe to the API Available to All the Tenants: users of all organizations/tenant domains can subscribe to the API Available to Specific Tenants: users of the organizations/tenant domains you specify as well as the current tenant domain can subscribe to the API
To connect to secured endpoints, you nee: To connect to secured endpoints, you need to pass the credentials of the backend service.
Type an Email and press Enter: Type an Email and press Enter
URI context path of the API (case sensit:
URI context path of the API (case sensitive).
The supported formats are..
1. /foo
2. /foo/bar
3. /foo/{version}/bar (case sensitive) - allows the version to be within the context
UnusualIPAccessAlert_Desc: This alert type gets triggered if there is either a change in the request source IP for a particular API of an application or if the request is from an IP used before a time period of 30 days (default). These alerts could be treated as an indication of a suspicious activity made by a user over an API of an application.
Usage by Current Subscribers (Across All: Usage by Current Subscribers (Across All Versions)
Use an existing API's endpoint or the AP: Use an existing API's endpoint or the API Swagger definition to create an API.
Use an existing SOAP endpoint to create: Use an existing SOAP endpoint to create a managed API. Import the WSDL of the SOAP service.
Use keywords and common search terms as: Use keywords and common search terms as tags to group APIs that have similar characteristics. After publishing the API, consumers can click these tags to jump to a group of similar APIs.
Use the inbuilt JavaScript engine to pro: Use the inbuilt JavaScript engine to prototype the API or provide an endpoint to a prototype API. The inbuilt JavaScript engine does not have support to prototype SOAP APIs
WSO2 API Manager uses HTTP Head to check: WSO2 API Manager uses HTTP Head to check the validity of the endpoint.
You are editing an API with active subsc: You are editing an API with active subscribers. Tier Availability changes will not be reflected on active subscriptions.

You have selected \"Dynamic Endpoint\" w: You have selected "Dynamic Endpoint" which will send the message to the address specified in the "To" header. Please upload a mediation sequence file to Message Mediation Policies, which sets the "To" header.

You have successfully saved the API.
You must first enter Production/ Sandbox: You must first enter Production/Sandbox endpoints to add a certificate or the endpoints you have entered are not considered valid.
You must upload a certificate file: You must upload a certificate file
AbnormalBackendTime_Desc: This alert gets triggered if the backend time corresponding to a particular API is higher than the predefined value. These alerts could be treated as an indication of a slow backend. In technical terms, if the backend time of a particular API  of a tenant lies outside the predefined value, an alert will be sent out.
abnormalRequestsPerMin_Desc: This alert type gets triggered if there is a sudden spike or a drop in the request count within a period of one minute by default for a particular API resource. These alerts could be treated as an indication of a possible high traffic, or suspicious activity, or possible malfunction of the client application, etc.
AbnormalResponseTime_Desc: This alert gets triggered if the response time of a particular API is higher than the predefined value. These alerts could be treated as an indication of a slow WSO2 API Manager runtime or a slow backend.
eg : pdf, xml, txt, wsdl, ms-word, ms-po: eg : pdf, xml, txt, wsdl, ms-word, ms-powerpoint, ms-excel
for more information about each throttli: for more information about each throttling setting.
ApiHealthMonitor_Desc: This alert gets triggered if at least one of the two cases below are satisfied; Response time of an API > Threshold response time value defined for that particular API  or Response status code >= 500 (By Default) AND Response status code < 600 (By Default)

Here a custom authorization header can b: A custom authorization header can be defined here as a replacement to the default Authorization header used to send a request. If a value is specified here, it will be used as the header field to send the access token in a request to consume the API
